result.execSummary:
The defendant Sakarean Desha Marshall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 3-20-16. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence - Time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sakarean Desha Marshall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sakarean Desha Marshall in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Defendant ordered to serve 1 day in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (1) day - Time served. 
Court ordered defendant is to pay all costs and surcharges by 3-20-2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge by 3-20-2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk jks
Defendant Sakarean Desha Marshall in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any weapons or firearms during the pendency of the case.

Defendant Sakarean Desha Marshall in court.  James J Martin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/19/15 @ 1:30pm
